pullRequest.body:
This PR defines a category of root pairings, roughly following the treatment of morphisms of root data in SGA3 Exp.21 Sec.6.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

</details>

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks so much for developing all this root system theory!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10769620062/job/29861213715)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10769620062/job/29861213383)

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma toLin_apply (p : PerfectPairing R M N) {x : M} : p.toLin x = p x := by
```
Thank you for this suggestion.  I had tried it earlier and got intimidated by the amount of rearranging that became necessary.  I'm glad I tried again.
Thanks so much for doing this!

I think we should first define morphisms without using the category theory library.

For example we could create a new file (maybe called `RootSystem/Hom.lean`) and in it define:
```lean
structure RootPairing.Hom (ι₂ M₂ N₂ : Type*)
    [AddCommGroup M₂] [Module R M₂] [AddCommGroup N₂] [Module R N₂]
    (P : RootPairing ι R M N) (Q : RootPairing ι₂ R M₂ N₂) where
  /-- A linear map on weight space. -/
  weightMap : M →ₗ[R] M₂
  /-- A contravariant linear map on coweight space. -/
  coweightMap : N₂ →ₗ[R] N
  /-- A bijection on index sets. -/
  indexEquiv : ι ≃ ι₂
  weight_coweight_transpose : weightMap.dualMap ∘ₗ Q.toDualRight = P.toDualRight ∘ₗ coweightMap
  root_weightMap : weightMap ∘ P.root = Q.root ∘ indexEquiv
  coroot_coweightMap : coweightMap ∘ Q.coroot = P.coroot ∘ indexEquiv.symm
```
together with basic boilerplate and then use this to define the `Category` instance below (similar to what is done for the category of modules [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/00df099f8ed42c12b35cdedcfbf1fde6c7413662/Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Basic.lean#L91-L97)).

I claim the advantages of this design are:

- We can have universe polymorphic morphisms
- It is possible to speak of morphisms without having to invoke the category theory library
- It is more idiomatic compared to the rest of our linear algebra

What do you think?
I have moved most of the Hom stuff into a `Hom.lean` file.  Would you prefer more category API here or in a new PR?
No need IMHO, though I'm excited to see what comes next :)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (LinearAlgebra/RootPairing): define RootPairingCat
